text: A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

<https://spin.d.pr/H0ohUb+>
<@U6W3H6YN8> <@U7ADCU3BM> and I built a Google chrome extension for HubSpot Devs and just published it to the Chrome Web Store. 

*Features:*
* HubSpot Cache Buster
* debug mode shortcut
* Shortcut to test moving jquery to the footer.
* Google Page Speed score tester

*Features in active development:*
* Dark Theme for the design Manager (will be toggle-able)
* Quick Access to the most commonly used HubL Docs

We have some other features we’re considering - you can see those in the github issues. We’re all working on this in our spare time, if you’re interested in contributing or have feedback let us know, we’re in the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> slack channel, and also you can submit issues on the repo.

Link to extension in Chrome Web Store:
<http://spin.d.pr/Z61sgv>

If you have feedback please use the proper channels to keep the reviews nice :slightly_smiling_face:
What are you some kind of sorcerer?

It’s a team effort, each of us so far has practically done an equal amount of work.

Wspiro did all the initial setup of the extension, and added the pagespeed, footer jquery, debugmode.

Gonzalo Torreras did all of the dark theme and the settings for it along with syncing the setting across Google accounts - which will be coming in an update likely within a week.

I did the cache buster, gave it a visual refresh, am working on a documentation shortcut feature coming in an update, again likely arriving within a week, made the icon(may change again), and did the Chrome web store setup.

Mostly though I just threw up a crap ton of issues on github and bugged the heck out of Gonzalo and Will with github notifications. XD
I don’t trust weavers of the dark arts
hahaha. Then don’t use Gonzalo’s Dark theme,(Gonzalo we should throw in an easter egg like a console log when enabled: “Professor Snape will be missed”)
lol

hahaha, noone likes :joy:.
Actually that was just a test, just trying some depths that at then ended in the published version :sweat_smile:.
We will fix that soon.
And yeah, maybe an easter egg with moving waves:thinking_face:
I HubSpot product team!
I am seeing somthing really weird in one of clients portals
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/FBAFV2H3K/screen_shot_2018-06-20_at_12.58.03_pm.jpg|Screen Shot 2018-06-20 at 12.58.03 PM.jpg>
Notice the `//` in the url
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/FBAR7MY3E/screen_shot_2018-06-20_at_12.58.16_pm.jpg|Screen Shot 2018-06-20 at 12.58.16 PM.jpg>
but it isnt in the actual URL. I
It doesnt seem to affect the actual url but my client gets weirded out about it.

We noticed yesterday that a preview link was putting /blog in a client's url for a page even though the page was hosted on their /news blog. It loaded the page fine but weird that it didn't have the proper blog directory in the URL.
<@U38EZFVFE> is that in the url of the blog settings url?
could it be that they added a /
Hmm good point
Nope. not the case
thanks for the thought tho <@U25C65C3S>
WOOOAAAA, THIS LOOKS AWESOME. Going to install and play around with. Thanks for the hard work on this <@U7SL518D6>

What's up my friends @here :wave:  I'm excited to announce our "HubSpot CMS Developer, Technical Ask Me Anything" event! :hugging_face:  This is a free, virtual event taking place on July 25th. 

Submit technical questions (in advance) and a panel of HubSpot development experts will answer them live on Zoom. 

Learn more and save your spot :point_right: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/ama>
Hey <@U22PKFRU5> who would you say this AMA is for?

Good question (will add this to the landing page) - It's for folks who see code and get excited. If someone sees code and is a bit scared to edit it, this isn't for them. 

For skill level of developer... It's open to all... Good coder but new to HubSpot CMS -> Advanced HubSpot CMS Dev.
